Trump and the 'derangement syndrome' driving people crazy
subhead: To discredit the president's opponents, the Make America Great Again movement has coined the phrase 'Trump derangement syndrome': a supposed mental illness that explains their systematic opposition. While the psychiatric argument for this has not been proven, many Democrats attest to the anger they feel every time the president speaks.

EU-Mercosur deal divides France's agricultural sectors
subhead: While the beef, poultry, beet, sugar, ethanol and cereal sectors fear increased competition from Mercosur trade bloc countries, the dairy, wine and spirits sectors stand to benefit from greater access to the Brazilian market.

title: In Ukraine, Russian forces increasingly target the railway network
subhead: Since the start of the year, the national rail company Ukrzaliznytsia has recorded more than 1,000 attacks. While most have been concentrated on stations near the Russian border and front line, the rest of the country has not been spared.

title: 'Emily in Paris,' season 5, on Netflix: Her weekend in Rome
subhead: The production moved a few episodes to Italy, where, once again, it is the character Sylvie, played by Philippine Leroy-Beaulieu, who delivers the best moments.

title: 'The Gospel is a bombshell. 'Love your neighbor' is such a radical message': Charlotte's conversion to Catholicism
subhead: 'Changing Faith' (1/11). Why do people choose a particular religion? Charlotte, a 23-year-old philosophy student in Paris, embraced Christianity as a teenager, but maintains her distance from the Church as an institution. She recounts her spiritual journey.

'It is easier to flatter the people than to serve. Therein lies the last obstacle to an RN victory in 2027'
subhead: Populism has never been stronger in France, but there is a crucial difference between flattering the people and serving them, and the Rassemblement National is currently stumbling on that divide, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhead: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.

title: Minnesota's Somali community stands up to Trump: 'We are no less American than other Americans'
subhead: After the revelation of a Covid-19 relief fraud scheme involving nearly 80 individuals of Somali origin, the American president deployed immigration police within the large Somali community in Minnesota, whose members are predominantly US citizens.
